    • Method Detail

      • SELECT_COMPANY

        public static java.lang.String SELECT_COMPANY()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to select company from Company table. SQL statement is: 
        SELECT * FROM company
        Returns:
        String represents SQL SELECT statement.

      • SELECT_COMPANY

        public static java.lang.String SELECT_COMPANY(java.lang.String ColumnsToSelect,
                                              java.lang.String whereCondition)
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to select company from Company table. SQL statement is: 
        SELECT [specified columns] FROM company [WHERE specified scope]
        Parameters:
        ColumnsToSelect - String represents specified columns (one or more) to select. If not null - modifies current prepared SQL statement. For example: 
        SELECT ID, COMP_NAME FROM company
        whereCondition - String represents specified scope for selecting. If not null - modifies current prepared SQL statement. For example: 
        SELECT * FROM company WHERE ID = ?
        Returns:
        String represents SQL SELECT statement.

      • SELECT_COMPANY_BY_ID

        public static java.lang.String SELECT_COMPANY_BY_ID()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to select company from Company table by id. SQL statement is: 
        SELECT * FROM company WHERE ID = ?
        where ? - is id of selected company.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL SELECT statement.

      • SELECT_COMPANY_BY_NAME

        public static java.lang.String SELECT_COMPANY_BY_NAME()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to select company from Company table by name. SQL statement is: 
        SELECT * FROM company WHERE COMP_NAME = ?
        where ? - is id of selected company.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL SELECT statement.

      • SELECT_COMPANY_BY_NAME_AND_PASSWORD

        public static java.lang.String SELECT_COMPANY_BY_NAME_AND_PASSWORD()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to select company from Company table by name and password. SQL statement is: 
        SELECT ID, EMAIL FROM company WHERE COMP_NAME = ? AND PASSWORD = ?
        where first ? - is the name of selected company and second ? - is password of the selected company.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL SELECT statement.

      • SELECT_COMPANY_FROM_COMPANY_COUPON

        public static java.lang.String SELECT_COMPANY_FROM_COMPANY_COUPON()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to select company from Company_Coupon table by company's id. SQL statement is: 
        SELECT * FROM company_coupon WHERE COMP_ID = ?
        where ? - is the id of selected company.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL SELECT statement.

      • INSERT_INTO_COMPANY

        public static java.lang.String INSERT_INTO_COMPANY()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to insert Company object into the company table. SQL statement is: 
        INSERT INTO company (COMP_NAME, PASSWORD, EMAIL) VALUES (?, ?, ?)
        where first ? - is the name of current Company object, second ? - is the password of current Company object, third ? - is the email of current Company object.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL INSERT statement.

      • INSERT_INTO_COMPANY_COUPON

        public static java.lang.String INSERT_INTO_COMPANY_COUPON()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to insert id of company and its coupon into the company_coupon table. SQL statement is: 
        INSERT INTO company_coupon (COMP_ID, COUPON_ID) VALUES (?, ?)
        where first ? - is the id of the company, second ? - is the id of the coupon.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL INSERT statement.

      • UPDATE_COMPANY

        public static java.lang.String UPDATE_COMPANY()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to apply changes to already exists company in company table. SQL statement is: 
        UPDATE company SET PASSWORD = ?, EMAIL = ? WHERE ID = ?
        where first ? - is the password of current company, second ? - is the email of current company, third ? - is the id of current company.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL UPDATE statement.

      • DELETE_COMPANY

        public static java.lang.String DELETE_COMPANY()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to delete current company from Company table. SQL statement is: 
        DELETE FROM company WHERE ID = ?
        where ? is ID of current company.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL DELETE statement.

      • DELETE_COMPANY_FROM_COMPANY_COUPON

        public static java.lang.String DELETE_COMPANY_FROM_COMPANY_COUPON()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to delete current company and its coupon from Company_Coupon table by company's id. SQL statement is: 
        DELETE FROM company_coupon WHERE COMP_ID = ?
        where ? is ID of current company.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL DELETE statement.
